member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Core.GeneratedRegexes.CdKey
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[0-9A-Z]{4,7}-[0-9A-Z]{4,7}-[0-9A-Z]{4,7}(?:(?:-[0-9A-Z]{4,7})?(?:-[0-9A-Z]{4,7}))?$
Options:
RegexOptions.IgnoreCase | RegexOptions.Compiled | RegexOptions.CultureInvariant
Explanation:
○ Match if at the beginning of the string.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9A-Za-z\u212A] atomically at least 4 and at most 7 times.
○ Match '-'.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9A-Za-z\u212A] atomically at least 4 and at most 7 times.
○ Match '-'.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9A-Za-z\u212A] greedily at least 4 and at most 7 times.
○ Optional (greedy).
○ Optional (greedy).
○ Match '-'.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9A-Za-z\u212A] atomically at least 4 and at most 7 times.
○ Match '-'.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9A-Za-z\u212A] greedily at least 4 and at most 7 times.
○ Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Core.GeneratedRegexes.Decimal
member.remarks:
Pattern:
[0-9\\.,]+
Options:
RegexOptions.IgnoreCase | RegexOptions.Compiled | RegexOptions.CultureInvariant
Explanation:
○ Match a character in the set [,.0-9] atomically at least once.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Core.GeneratedRegexes.Digits
member.remarks:
Pattern:
\\d+
Options:
RegexOptions.IgnoreCase | RegexOptions.Compiled | RegexOptions.CultureInvariant
Explanation:
○ Match a Unicode digit atomically at least once.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Core.GeneratedRegexes.InventoryEResult
member.remarks:
Pattern:
EResult (?<EResult>\\d+)$
Options:
RegexOptions.IgnoreCase | RegexOptions.Compiled | RegexOptions.CultureInvariant
Explanation:
○ Match a character in the set [Ee].
○ Match a character in the set [Rr].
○ Match a character in the set [Ee].
○ Match a character in the set [Ss].
○ Match a character in the set [Uu].
○ Match a character in the set [Ll].
○ Match a character in the set [Tt].
○ Match ' '.
○ "EResult" capture group.
○ Match a Unicode digit atomically at least once.
○ Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Core.GeneratedRegexes.NonAscii
member.remarks:
Pattern:
[^\\u0000-\\u007F]+
Options:
RegexOptions.IgnoreCase | RegexOptions.Compiled | RegexOptions.CultureInvariant
Explanation:
○ Match a character in the set [^\0-\u007F\u212A] atomically at least once.

member.name: T:ArchiSteamFarm.Helpers.Json.GuidJsonConverter
member.summary: TODO: This class exists purely because STJ can't deserialize Guid in other formats than default, at least for now https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/30692

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Helpers.SerializableFile.Save
member.summary: Implementing this method in your target class is crucial for providing supported functionality. In order to do so, it's enough to call static function from the parent class, providing this as input parameter. Afterwards, simply call your function whenever you need to save changes. This approach will allow JSON serializer used in the to properly discover all of the properties used in your class. Unfortunately, due to STJ's limitations, called by some "security", it's not possible for base class to resolve your properties automatically otherwise.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Controllers.Api.BotController.RedeemPost(System.String,ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.BotRedeemRequest)
member.summary: Redeems cd-keys on given bot.
member.remarks: Response contains a map that maps each provided cd-key to its redeem result. Redeem result can be a null value, this means that ASF didn't even attempt to send a request (e.g. because of bot not being connected to Steam network).

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Controllers.Api.CommandController.CommandPost(ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.CommandRequest)
member.summary: Executes a command.
member.remarks: This API endpoint is supposed to be entirely replaced by ASF actions available under /Api/ASF/{action} and /Api/Bot/{bot}/{action}. You should use "given bot" commands when executing this endpoint, omitting targets of the command will cause the command to be executed on first defined bot

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Controllers.Api.GitHubController.GitHubReleaseGet
member.summary: Fetches the most recent GitHub release of ASF project.
member.remarks: This is internal API being utilizied by our ASF-ui IPC frontend. You should not depend on existence of any /Api/WWW endpoints as they can disappear and change anytime.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Controllers.Api.GitHubController.GitHubReleaseGet(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches specific GitHub release of ASF project. Use "latest" for latest stable release.
member.remarks: This is internal API being utilizied by our ASF-ui IPC frontend. You should not depend on existence of any /Api/WWW endpoints as they can disappear and change anytime.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Controllers.Api.GitHubController.GitHubWikiHistoryGet(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches history of specific GitHub page from ASF project.
member.remarks: This is internal API being utilizied by our ASF-ui IPC frontend. You should not depend on existence of any /Api/WWW endpoints as they can disappear and change anytime.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Controllers.Api.GitHubController.GitHubWikiPageGet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fetches specific GitHub page of ASF project.
member.remarks: This is internal API being utilizied by our ASF-ui IPC frontend. You should not depend on existence of any /Api/WWW endpoints as they can disappear and change anytime. Specifying revision is optional - when not specified, will fetch latest available. If specified revision is invalid, GitHub will automatically fetch the latest revision as well.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Controllers.Api.NLogController.FileGet(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetches ASF log file, this works on assumption that the log file is in fact generated, as user could disable it through custom configuration.
member.param: Maximum amount of lines from the log file returned. The respone naturally might have less amount than specified, if you've read whole file already.

Ending index, used for pagination. Omit it for the first request, then initialize to TotalLines returned, and on every following request subtract count that you've used in the previous request from it until you hit 0 or less, which means you've read whole file already.

member.remarks: This API endpoint requires a websocket connection.

member.summary: A string-string map that maps cd-key to redeem (key) to its name (value).
member.remarks: Key in the map must be a valid and unique Steam cd-key. Value in the map must be a non-null and non-empty name of the key (e.g. game's name, but can be anything).

member.summary: Specifies the type of the input.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.BotInputRequest.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value for given input type (declared in )

member.summary: Specifies if pause is permanent or temporary (default).

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.BotPauseRequest.ResumeInSeconds
member.summary: Specifies automatic resume action in given seconds. Default value of 0 disables automatic resume.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.BotRedeemRequest.KeysToRedeem
member.summary: A collection (set) of keys to redeem.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.BotRenameRequest.NewName
member.summary: Specifies the new name for the bot. The new name can't be "ASF", neither the one used by any existing bot.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.BotRequest.BotConfig
member.summary: ASF's bot config structure.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.CommandRequest.Command
member.summary: Specifies the command that will be executed by ASF.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.PluginUpdateRequest.Channel
member.summary: Target update channel. Not required, will default to if not provided.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.PluginUpdateRequest.Forced
member.summary: Forced update. This allows ASF to potentially downgrade to previous version available on selected , which isn't permitted normally.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.PluginUpdateRequest.Plugins
member.summary: Target plugins. Not required, will default to plugin update configuration in if not provided.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.TwoFactorAuthenticationConfirmationsRequest.Accept
member.summary: Specifies the target action, whether we should accept the confirmations (true), or decline them (false).

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.TwoFactorAuthenticationConfirmationsRequest.AcceptedCreatorIDs
member.summary: Specifies IDs of the confirmations that we're supposed to handle. CreatorID of the confirmation is equal to ID of the object that triggered it - e.g. ID of the trade offer, or ID of the market listing. If not provided, or empty array, all confirmation IDs are considered for an action.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.TwoFactorAuthenticationConfirmationsRequest.AcceptedType
member.summary: Specifies the type of confirmations to handle. If not provided, all confirmation types are considered for an action.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.TwoFactorAuthenticationConfirmationsRequest.SAcceptedCreatorIDs
member.summary: A helper property which works the same as but with values written as strings - for javascript compatibility purposes. Use either this one, or , not both.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.TwoFactorAuthenticationConfirmationsRequest.WaitIfNeeded
member.summary: Specifies whether we should wait for the confirmations to arrive, in case they're not available immediately. This option makes sense only if is specified as well, and in this case ASF will add a few more tries if needed to ensure that all specified IDs are handled. Useful if confirmations are generated with a delay on Steam network side, which happens fairly often.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.UpdateRequest.Channel
member.summary: Target update channel. Not required, will default to UpdateChannel in GlobalConfig if not provided.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Requests.UpdateRequest.Forced
member.summary: Forced update. This allows ASF to potentially downgrade to previous version available on selected , which isn't permitted normally.

member.summary: ASF's build variant.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.ASFResponse.CanUpdate

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.ASFResponse.GlobalConfig

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.ASFResponse.ProcessStartTime

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.ASFResponse.Version
member.summary: ASF version of currently running binary.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.GamesToRedeemInBackgroundResponse.UnusedKeys

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.GamesToRedeemInBackgroundResponse.UsedKeys

member.summary: The actual result of the request, if available.
member.remarks: The type of the result depends on the API endpoint that you've called.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.GenericResponse.Message
member.summary: A message that describes what happened with the request, if available.
member.remarks: This property will provide exact reason for majority of expected failures.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.GenericResponse.Success
member.summary: Boolean type that specifies if the request has succeeded.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.GitHubReleaseResponse.ChangelogHTML
member.summary: Changelog of the release rendered in HTML.

member.summary: Date of the release.

member.summary: Boolean value that specifies whether the build is stable or not (pre-release).

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.GitHubReleaseResponse.Version
member.summary: Version of the release.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.LogResponse.Content
member.summary: Content of the log file which consists of lines read from it - in chronological order.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.LogResponse.TotalLines
member.summary: Total number of lines of the log file returned, can be used as an index for future requests.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.StatusCodeResponse.Permanent
member.summary: Value indicating whether the status is permanent. If yes, retrying the request with exactly the same payload doesn't make sense due to a permanent problem (e.g. ASF misconfiguration).

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.StatusCodeResponse.StatusCode
member.summary: Status code transmitted in addition to the one in HTTP spec.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.TypeProperties.BaseType
member.summary: Base type of given type, if available.
member.remarks: This can be used for determining how the body of the response should be interpreted.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.TypeProperties.CustomAttributes
member.summary: Custom attributes of given type, if available.
member.remarks: This can be used for determining main enum type if is .

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.TypeProperties.UnderlyingType
member.summary: Underlying type of given type, if available.
member.remarks: This can be used for determining underlying enum type if is .

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.TypeResponse.Body
member.summary: A string-string map representing a decomposition of given type.
member.remarks: The actual structure of this field depends on the type that was requested. You can determine that type based on metadata. For enums, keys are friendly names while values are underlying values of those names. For objects, keys are non-private fields and properties, while values are underlying types of those.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.IPC.Responses.TypeResponse.Properties
member.summary: Metadata of given type.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IASF.OnASFInit(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Text.Json.JsonElement})
member.summary: ASF will call this method right after global config initialization.
member.param: Extra config properties made out of . Can be null if no extra properties are found.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBot.OnBotDestroy(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot)
member.summary: ASF will call this method after removing its own references from it, e.g. after config removal. You should ensure that you'll remove any of your own references to this bot instance in timely manner. Doing so will allow the garbage collector to dispose the bot afterwards, refraining from doing so will create a "memory leak" by keeping the reference alive.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBot.OnBotInit(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot)
member.summary: ASF will call this method after creating the bot object, e.g. after config creation. Bot config is not yet available at this stage. This function will execute only once for every bot object.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotCardsFarmerInfo.OnBotFarmingFinished(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,System.Boolean)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when cards farming module is finished on given bot instance. This method will also be called when there is nothing to idle or idling is unavailable, you can use provided boolean value for determining that.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
Bool value indicating whether the module has finished successfully, so when there was at least one card to drop, and nothing has interrupted us in the meantime.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotCardsFarmerInfo.OnBotFarmingStarted(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when cards farming module is started on given bot instance. The module is started only when there are valid cards to drop, so this method won't be called when there is nothing to idle.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotCardsFarmerInfo.OnBotFarmingStopped(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when cards farming module is stopped on given bot instance. The stop could be a result of a natural finish, or other situations (e.g. Steam networking issues, user commands).
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotCommand2.OnBotCommand(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.EAccess,System.String,System.String[],System.UInt64)
member.summary: ASF will call this method for unrecognized commands.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
Access of user executing the command.
Command message in its raw format, stripped of .
Pre-parsed message using standard ASF delimiters.
Optionally, steamID of the user who executed the command - may not be available with value of 0 (e.g. ASF API).
member.returns: Response to the command, or null/empty (as the task value) if the command isn't handled by this plugin.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotConnection.OnBotDisconnected(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,SteamKit2.EResult)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when bot gets disconnected from Steam network.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
Reason for disconnection, or if the disconnection was initiated by ASF (e.g. as a result of a command).

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotConnection.OnBotLoggedOn(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when bot successfully connects to Steam network.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotCustomMachineInfoProvider.GetMachineInfoProvider(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot)
member.summary: ASF will use this property as the for the specified bot. Unless you know what you're doing, you should not implement this interface yourself and let ASF decide.
member.remarks: This method will be called with very limited amount of bot-related data, as it's used during bot initialization. We recommend to stick with , and exclusively.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
member.returns: that will be used for the particular bot. You can return null if you want to use default implementation.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotFriendRequest.OnBotFriendRequest(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,System.UInt64)
member.summary: ASF will call this method for unhandled (ignored and rejected) friend requests and Steam group invites received by the bot.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
64-bit Steam identificator of the user that sent a friend request, or a group that the bot has been invited to.
member.returns: True if the request should be accepted as part of this plugin, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotIdentity.OnSelfPersonaState(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,SteamKit2.SteamFriends.PersonaStateCallback,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when bot receives its own identity information.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
Full data received by ASF in the callback that relates to this bot (Steam) account.
Parsed nickname set for this bot (Steam) account.
Parsed hash of the avatar of this bot (Steam) account, as hex.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotMessage.OnBotMessage(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,System.UInt64,System.String)
member.summary: ASF will call this method for messages that are not commands, so ones that do not start from .
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
64-bit long unsigned integer of steamID executing the command.
Message in its raw format.
member.returns: Response to the message, or null/empty (as the task value) for silence.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotModules.OnBotInitModules(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Text.Json.JsonElement})
member.summary: ASF will call this method right after bot config initialization.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
Extra config properties made out of . Can be null if no extra properties are found.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotsComparer.BotsComparer
member.summary: ASF will use this property for determining the comparer for the bots. Unless you know what you're doing, you should not implement this property yourself and let ASF decide.
member.returns: Comparer that will be used for the bots, as well as bot regexes.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotSteamClient.OnBotSteamCallbacksInit(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,SteamKit2.CallbackManager)
member.summary: ASF will call this method right after custom SK2 client handler initialization in order to allow you listening for callbacks in your own code.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
Callback manager object which can be used for establishing subscriptions to standard and custom callbacks.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotSteamClient.OnBotSteamHandlersInit(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot)
member.summary: ASF will call this method right after bot initialization in order to allow you hooking custom SK2 client handlers into the SteamClient.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
member.returns: Collection of custom client handlers that are supposed to be hooked into the SteamClient by ASF. If you do not require any, just return null or empty collection.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotTradeOffer.OnBotTradeOffer(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Data.TradeOffer)
member.summary: ASF will call this method for unhandled (ignored and rejected) trade offers received by the bot.

Trade offer related to this callback.
member.returns: True if the trade offer should be accepted as part of this plugin, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotTradeOfferResults.OnBotTradeOfferResults(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Exchange.ParseTradeResult})
member.summary: ASF will call this method for notifying you about the result of each received trade offer being handled. The method is executed for each batch that can contain 1 or more trade offers.

Trade results related to this callback.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IBotUserNotifications.OnBotUserNotifications(ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Bot,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{ArchiSteamFarm.Steam.Integration.Callbacks.UserNotificationsCallback.EUserNotification})
member.summary: ASF will call this method when number of notifications for one or more notification types changes.
member.param: Bot object related to this callback.
Collection containing those notification types that are new (that is, when new count > previous count of that notification type).

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.ICrossProcessSemaphoreProvider.GetCrossProcessSemaphore(System.String)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when initializing instance of for its internal limiters.
member.param: Unique resource name provided by ASF for identification purposes.
member.returns: Concrete implementation of providing required functionality. It's allowed to return null if you want to use ASF's default implementation for specified resource instead.

member.name: T:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IGitHubPluginUpdates
member.summary: Implementing this interface allows your plugin to update from published releases on GitHub. At the minimum you must provide . If you're not following our ASF-PluginTemplate flow, that is, providing release asset named differently than "{PluginName}.zip" then you may also need to override function in order to select target asset based on custom rules. If you have even more complex needs for updating your plugin, you should probably consider implementing base interface instead, where you can provide your own implementation, with optional help from our .

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IGitHubPluginUpdates.CanUpdate
member.summary: Boolean value that determines whether your plugin is able to update at the time of calling. You may provide false if, for example, you're inside a critical section and you don't want to update at this time, despite supporting updates otherwise. This effectively skips unnecessary request to GitHub if you're certain that you're not interested in any updates right now.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IGitHubPluginUpdates.RepositoryName
member.summary: ASF will use this property as a target for GitHub updates. GitHub repository specified here must have valid releases that will be used for updates.
member.returns: Repository name in format of {Author}/{Repository}.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IGitHubPluginUpdates.GetTargetReleaseAsset(System.Version,System.String,System.Version,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{ArchiSteamFarm.Web.GitHub.Data.ReleaseAsset})
member.summary: ASF will call this function for determining the target asset name to update to. This asset should be available in specified release. It's permitted to return null if you want to cancel update to given version. Default implementation provides vastly universal generic matching, see remarks for more info.
member.param: Target ASF version that plugin update should be compatible with. In rare cases, this might not match currently running ASF version, in particular when updating to newer release and checking if any plugins are compatible with it.
ASF variant of current instance, which may be useful if you're providing different versions for different ASF variants.
The target (new) version of the plugin found available in .
Available release assets for auto-update. Those come directly from your release on GitHub.
member.remarks: Default implementation will select release asset in following order: - {Name}-V{Major}-{Minor}-{Build}-{Revision}.zip - {Name}-V{Major}-{Minor}-{Build}.zip - {Name}-V{Major}-{Minor}.zip - {Name}-V{Major}.zip - {Name}.zip - *.zip, if exactly 1 release asset matching in the release Where: - {Name} will be tried out of and assembly name that provides your plugin type - {Major} is target major ASF version (A from A.B.C.D) - {Minor} is target minor ASF version (B from A.B.C.D) - {Build} is target build (patch) ASF version (C from A.B.C.D) - {Revision} is target revision ASF version (D from A.B.C.D) - * is a wildcard matching any string value For example, when updating MyAwesomePlugin declared in JustArchiNET.MyAwesomePlugin assembly with ASF version V6.0.1.3, it will select the first zip file available from those below: - MyAwesomePlugin-V6.0.1.3.zip - MyAwesomePlugin-V6.0.1.zip - MyAwesomePlugin-V6.0.zip - MyAwesomePlugin-V6.zip - MyAwesomePlugin.zip - JustArchiNET.MyAwesomePlugin-V6.0.1.3.zip - JustArchiNET.MyAwesomePlugin-V6.0.1.zip - JustArchiNET.MyAwesomePlugin-V6.0.zip - JustArchiNET.MyAwesomePlugin-V6.zip - JustArchiNET.MyAwesomePlugin.zip - *.zip, if exactly one match is found
member.returns: Target release asset from those provided that should be used for auto-update. You may return null if the update is unavailable, for example, because ASF version/variant is determined unsupported, or due to any other reason.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IPlugin.Name
member.summary: ASF will use this property as general plugin identifier for the user.
member.returns: String that will be used as the name of this plugin.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IPlugin.Version
member.summary: ASF will use this property as version indicator of your plugin to the user. You have a freedom in deciding what versioning you want to use, this is for identification purposes only.
member.returns: Version that will be shown to the user when plugin is loaded.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IPlugin.OnLoaded
member.summary: ASF will call this method right after plugin initialization.

member.name: T:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginUpdates
member.summary: Implementing this interface allows you to provide custom logic for updating your plugin to newer version. Plugin updates are happening on usual basis per configuration of auto-updates from ASF, as well as other triggers such as update command. If you're using GitHub platform with plugin releases, you might be interested in instead.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginUpdates.GetTargetReleaseURL(System.Version,System.String,System.Boolean,ArchiSteamFarm.Storage.GlobalConfig.EUpdateChannel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: ASF will call this function for determining the target release asset URL to update to.
member.param: Target ASF version that plugin update should be compatible with. In rare cases, this might not match currently running ASF version, in particular when updating to newer release and checking if any plugins are compatible with it.
ASF variant of current instance, which may be useful if you're providing different versions for different ASF variants.
Boolean value specifying whether ASF is being updated right now to given version.
ASF update channel specified for this request. This might be different from the one specified in , as user might've specified other one for this request.
Boolean value specifying whether user has requested forced plugin update, that is, one that should always execute if possible - even with the same and lower version (downgrade).
member.returns: Target release asset URL that should be used for auto-update. It's permitted to return null if you want to skip update, e.g. because no new version is available.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginUpdates.OnPluginUpdateFinished
member.summary: ASF will call this method after update to the new plugin version has been finished, just before restart of the process.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginUpdates.OnPluginUpdateProceeding
member.summary: ASF will call this method before proceeding with an update to the new plugin version.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.ISteamPICSChanges.GetPreferredChangeNumberToStartFrom
member.summary: ASF uses this method for determining the point in time from which it should keep history going upon a restart. The actual point in time that will be used is calculated as the lowest change number from all loaded plugins, to guarantee that no plugin will miss any changes, while allowing possible duplicates for those plugins that were already synchronized with newer changes. If you don't care about persistent state and just want to receive the ongoing history, you should return 0 (which is equal to "I'm fine with any"). If there won't be any plugin asking for a specific point in time, ASF will start returning entries since the start of the program.
member.returns: The most recent change number from which you're fine to receive .

member.summary: ASF will call this method upon receiving any app/package PICS changes. The history is guaranteed to be precise and continuous starting from until is called. It's possible for this method to have duplicated calls across different runs, in particular when some other plugin asks for lower , therefore you should keep that in mind (and refer to change number of standalone apps/packages).
member.param: The change number of current callback.
App changes that happened since the previous call of this method. Can be empty.
Package changes that happened since the previous call of this method. Can be empty.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.ISteamPICSChanges.OnPICSChangesRestart(System.UInt32)
member.summary: ASF will call this method when it'll be necessary to restart the history of PICS changes. This can happen due to Steam limitation in which we're unable to keep history going if we're too far behind (approx 5k changeNumbers). If you're relying on continuous history of app/package PICS changes sent by , ASF can no longer guarantee that upon calling this method, therefore you should start clean.
member.param: The change number from which we're restarting the PICS history.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IUpdateAware.OnUpdateFinished(System.Version,System.Version)
member.summary: ASF will call this method after update to a particular ASF version has been finished, just before restart of the process.
member.param: The current (old) version of ASF program.
The target (new) version of ASF program.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IUpdateAware.OnUpdateProceeding(System.Version,System.Version)
member.summary: ASF will call this method before proceeding with an update to a particular ASF version.
member.param: The current (old) version of ASF program.
The target (new) version of ASF program.

member.name: T:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IWebInterface
member.summary: Implementing this interface allows you to provide your own (custom) web interface files that will be exposed by standard ASF's IPC interface. In order to achieve that, you must include a directory with your web interface (html, css, js) files together with your plugin's DLL assembly, then specify path to it in and finally the path under which you want to host those files in .

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IWebInterface.PhysicalPath
member.summary: Specifies physical path to static WWW files provided by the plugin. Can be either relative to plugin's assembly location, or absolute. Default value of "www" assumes that you ship "www" directory together with your plugin's main DLL assembly, similar to ASF.

member.name: P:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IWebInterface.WebPath
member.summary: Specifies web path (address) under which ASF should host your static WWW files in directory. Default value of "/" allows you to override default ASF files and gives you full flexibility in your directory. However, you can instead host your files under some other fixed location specified here, such as "/MyPlugin".

member.name: T:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IWebServiceProvider
member.summary: Implementing this interface allows you to provide your own additional services and middlewares for IPC endpoints - Use with caution!

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IWebServiceProvider.OnConfiguringEndpoints(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary: ASF will call this method during configuration of the IPC endpoints
member.param: Application builder related to this callback.

member.name: M:ArchiSteamFarm.Plugins.Interfaces.IWebServiceProvider.OnConfiguringServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: ASF will call this method during configuration of the IPC services
member.param: Service collection related to this callback.
